page.title: 03Interior of Polstead church
page.content: Inside the church items of interest to the visitor include the thirteenth century font and fifteenth century brasses.The brasses show a priest in communion robes and a family of 1490.The Brand memorial is said to commemorate an accident in about 1630 when the youngest son of the Brand family of Polstead hall,fell from one of the three hundred and sixty-five windows of the Hall.At one time the custom of "Borough English"used to prevail at Polstead Hall,whereby the youngest son inherited the Hall.Part of a medieval fresco remains on the walls with several coats of arms of past Lords of the Manor,also details of two local charities.The registers date from 1538 and give interesting details of local people who sailed in the Mayflower,or perished in the Plague or Civil War.
